Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.notes:
Follow all conditions of agreement 
Bail continued

charges.descr: Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Andrew Zimbric

records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM Defendant Mark Andrew Zimbric in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Schiek statement to agreement.  State moves to amend to misdemeanor -OMVWOC - abandon- Granted.  DEJ filed -  Plea questionnaire partially filled out filed. Defendant will proceed on own and plead guilty to amended charge. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea, and waiver/benefits of counsel. Waivers free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists but will defer judgment and accept the DEJ. 
Bail continued.
Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

3:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark Andrew Zimbric in court. State has filed information. - provided to Defendant. Defendant willing to proceed to Arraignment - Court enters not guilty pleas. Court directs Defendant to make appointment with DA's office. adj. 03:53 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - DENIED/mailed copy to defendant

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark Andrew Zimbric in court. Court review of case. Defendant states not eligible for PD - would like court appointed counsel - needs to submit. Court finds Defendant waived right to counsel for today's hearing. State calls Rhinelander Police Officer Claire Herfindahl/direct by Pfeifer/witness identifies defendant/continued direct by Pfeifer/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds over. Court will set for arraignment. Court directs Defendant to drop off application for court appointed counsel. Bond continued. adj. 09:13 AM
Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Andrew Zimbric in court. Court goes over record.  Atty Schiek statement to court states he spoke with defendant before going on the record and defendant stated he would like to seek counsel. Court adjourns for defendant to obtain counsel.  adj: 11:09 a.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark Andrew Zimbric in court. Court review of case - questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant states would like to waive right to counsel. Court reads on waiver of counsel - waiver free and voluntary. Defendant would like hearing within 20 days. Bond continued. adj. 03:41 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Andrew Zimbric in court. 
Defendant makes Voluntary Appearance.  Warrant now quashed
In receipt, right to counsel.
Pfeifer to bail - Court sets  $  sig bond. Court statement to defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Andrew Zimbric not in court. 
Pfeifer statement - Def was given citation.  Court authorizes warrant.
